Drake Lab Blog

We are a group of population and disease ecologists in the Odum School of Ecology at University of Georgia.

About

Welcome to the Drake lab blog. We are a part of the Odum School of Ecology at the University of Georgia. Our interests are diverse, but deal generally with the population and community ecology of infectious disease. For information on lab projects, see our website. This blog serves as a platform for sharing useful code, and methods to overcome common problems that we've faced.

This blog was created on the Jekyll platform, templating from Hyde,and hosted on GitHub.

Have questions or suggestions? Feel free to contact us, or report an issue on Github.

Thanks for reading!
